job_title: Intelligence Researcher in Milton Keynes, England
pros:
It uses the administrative services of mib that offers the following benefits:
-Subsidised canteen which i miss quite a lot as the food was good and the prices were reasonable. The staff were also nice.
-£100 off gym membership
-Decent social club and activites

The hours are 9 to 5 which is decent for work life balance.

The IFB offer good salary and bonus ( the best "pro")

People in the IFB are generally nice
cons:
No flexi

The job can be boring at times at the IFB

Progression is dependant on people leaving and then making sure you have made friends with management. Much easier for female colleagues to progress than male.

Very difficult for male colleagues of BAME background to progress and the very few that have done had to do it the hard way despite having superior experience and qualifications than colleagues of non bame background.

Some members of the management are a bit "old school"

The office can be incredibly quiet and banter is looked down upon. They also dont like people leaving work on time. They like people to stay late as it shows you "work hard".

I felt i didnt get the care amd respect i deserved when i went through a very difficult time in my life even though i turned upto work everyday on time unlike some people who abuse the system and take many stress leaves. I always volunteered to do additional tasks outside by normal duties when going through this tough personal period but sadly i didnt get the recognition.
